CatDescriptText: Conley Powell, VA hospital worker and technical school student, 7430 Monticello Street , was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciation financial help from racketeers?" Answer reads: "Indirectly, they receive a certain amount because there are always going to be church members who are indirectly involved in the rackets. However, I would say that in colored churches the amount is not great because there are not many people in such positions to give the help."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Conley Powell wearing overcoat and standing on sidewalk against light colored wall with door marked "407," car and buildings in background
